summary: Constance C Smith was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents available are certification reports and payroll certifications listing HSCA employees, their positions, annual salaries, and gross pay for various accounting periods in 1978. While the specific role of Constance C Smith within the HSCA is not detailed in the provided summaries, the documents confirm her employment during the period from May to November 1978. The documents do not provide any information about her direct involvement in the JFK assassination investigation, but rather establish her as a staff member of the committee.
significance: Constance C Smith's significance lies in her being a staff member of the HSCA, the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations. The documents indicate her employment during the period from May to November 1978. While her specific role in the JFK assassination investigation is not detailed, her presence on the payroll and certification reports confirms her involvement in the operations of the committee.
